io.elegie.luchess.app.lucene4x.explore

Class GameListQueryImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elegie.luchess.app.lucene4x.explore.AbstractQueryImpl
      • io.elegie.luchess.app.lucene4x.explore.GameListQueryImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameListQuery, Query<GameListQueryResult>

    public class GameListQueryImpl
extends AbstractQueryImpl
implements GameListQuery
    Our implementation of the GameListQuery. This class acts as a controller, delegating the actual query building to a GameListQueryBuilder, creating a GameListQueryCollector and GameListQuerySimilarity that let us collect continuations, then executing the query against a properly configured index searcher.

      • execute

        public GameListQueryResult execute()
                            throws QueryException
        Description copied from interface: Query
        Execute the query. We do not make any assumption on the result returned by the query, and let implementations decide whether they want a fully-loaded or lazily-loaded result set.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Query<GameListQueryResult>
        Returns:
        The result of the query, containing all relevant data.
        Throws:
        QueryException - When the Query could not be executed, because of technical (non-domain) problems, such as a non-existing or unreachable index.
